hook.text: Russia calls it 'hybrid warfare.' China calls it 'three warfares.' Information is now a battlefield like land and sea.

buildup.text: Information warfare uses media, social platforms, and cyber tools to shape perceptions and weaken adversaries.

discovery.text: Russia's doctrine treats information as a weapon of first resort. It attacks narratives before attacking territory.

twist.text: Democracies are more vulnerable. Open societies can't control information flows the way authoritarian states can.

climax.text: Defending against information warfare requires media literacy, platform regulation, and international cooperation.

punchline.text: Information warfare is real war by other means. Words are the new weapons.

quiz.question: Why are democracies particularly vulnerable to information warfare?
options: Open societies cannot control information flows like authoritarian states can
Democracies have no media at all
All citizens in democracies are media-literate
